details:
UnRTF is a command-line program written in C which converts documents in Rich Text Format (.rtf) to HTML, LaTeX, troff macros, and RTF itself. Converting to HTML, it supports a number of features of Rich Text Format:     * Changes in the text&apos;s font, size, weight (bold), and slant (italic)     * Underlines and strikethroughs     * Partial support for text shadowing, outlining, embossing, or engraving     * Capitalizations     * Superscripts and subscripts     * Expanded and condensed text     * Changes in the foreground and background colors     * Conversion of special characters to HTML entities

Security Fix(es):

A stack overflow in the src/main.c component of GNU Unrtf v0.21.10 allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via injecting a crafted input into the filename parameter.(CVE-2025-65410)
